context: Adenotonsillectomy, primary, patient under age 12.   (Medical Transcription Sample Report)

text: Codeine caused her to be excitable
context: Codeine caused her to be excitable, but she did not actually have an allergic reaction to codeine.
Mouthgag was again released, reopened, no bleeding was seen.
Orogastric suction carried out with only scant clear stomach contents.

text: There was no bifid uvula or submucous cleft.
context: There was no bifid uvula or submucous cleft.
She had 3+ cryptic tonsils with significant debris in the tonsillar crypts.
She had mild-to-moderate adenoidal tissue residual.
This patient was brought from the holding area and did receive preoperative antibiotics of Cleocin as well as IV Decadron.
Injection at each peritonsillar area with 0.25% with Marcaine with 1:200,000 Epinephrine, approximately 1.5 mL total volume.

The left superior tonsillar pole was then grasped with curved Allis forceps. _______ incision and dissection in the tonsillar capsule and hemostasis and removal of the tonsil was obtained with Coblation Evac Xtra Wand on 7/3. Mouthgag was released, reopened, no bleeding was seen. The right tonsil was then removed in the same fashion.

In the holding area, her allergies were reviewed. It is unclear whether she is actually allergic to penicillin. Codeine caused her to be excitable, but she did not actually have an allergic reaction to codeine. She might be allergic to BACTRIM and SULFA.
Postoperatively, the patient will be on Zithromax oral suspension 500 mg daily for 5 to 7 days, Lortab Elixir for pain. _______ and promethazine if needed for nausea and vomiting.
